content: Or restore from your own backup.
creator: wsmwk

content: The 'allmail' folder can be confusing, since it represents ALL mail. I recommend never subscribing to the allmail folder in Thunderbird for that reason. If you have deleted trash and nothing shows, then I know of no way to recover.
creator: davidsk

content: I don't have an answer but I can tell you that its not only happening in my thunderbird client but also in Windows Mail which I had stopped using but tried again anyway. It does not see to be a thunderbird specific issue. I've been searching for the answer for 3 days. Haven't found it and nothing I've tried has solved it. In my case Thunderbird is telling me it can not connect to the imap.gmail.com server. I can confirm that deleting your account to attempt to add it back does not work and actually you can't add it back in because of the same problem...won't connect to the server.
creator: hls00

content: To reset your password, you need to log in to your online account, as your password is a control between you and your email host. Your email host will not provide new passwords to other than you.
creator: davidsk

content:
Ciao, anzitutto una precisazione, questo è solo un forum per gli utenti non un supporto tecnico. Inoltre il forum è pubblico per cui è il caso di mascherare i dati privati

Detto questo, la domanda non mi è chiara. Hai inviato una mail ad un indirizzo gMail e hai ricevuto questo messaggio di errore? Se è così, è probabile che Google non ritenga affidabile il tuo indirizzo probabilmente perché non implementa correttamente i protocolli DKIM e SPF.

Se la situazione è questa, gli unici a poter fare qualcosa sono la società che gestisce la tua mail ed ovviamente la stessa Gmail. Thunderbird non c'entra, è solo un programma per gestire la posta elettronica.
creator: @next

content: In the message list pane, look at the top line, which shows 'subject, from, date, etc....' to sort by any of the words, click and the message list will resort. My perception is that it is sorted by subject. Click 'date' to sort by date.
creator: davidsk

content: If that HTML is in the outgoing message, then other clients will see the color. please send me a test message to davidthunderbird at gmx dot com
creator: davidsk

content: You should be able to create a local folder and copy messages to the local folder and then delete from server.
creator: davidsk

content: Does 465 still work? I suggest experimenting a bit. Try 465 and see if that works. If not, change the authentication (e.g., if it was ssl/tls, try starttls). ALso, try changing authentication with 587. It is not unusual for email hosts to give incomplete instructions. Let us know.
creator: davidsk

content: NetSol noticed I was still using port 465 and advised me to use 587 for the sake of compatibility with v1.2. But now I cannot send emails.
creator: danbollinger

content: I am a bit confused. Thunderbird has supported TLS 1.2 for a long time, so I don't know why you made any changes.
creator: davidsk

content:
Non c'è nessuna procedura. Puoi allegare alle mail file grandi quanto vuoi, ma se il tuo destinatario ha dei limiti in ricezione non le riceverà.

Per questo sopra diciamo i 20 MB si appoggiano i file ad un servizio cloud tipo Dropbox e nell'email si invia solo il relativo link.
creator: @next
